intro: Heliophila adpressa, commonly known as the flatleaf water plantain, is a species of flowering plant in the family Alismataceae. It is a perennial herb that typically grows in wetland environments such as marshes and shallow water areas. The plant has narrow, linear leaves that are often submerged or floating, and it produces small, white or pale yellow flowers. Heliophila adpressa is characterized by its rhizomatous growth habit and its ability to thrive in aquatic or semi-aquatic conditions. It plays an important ecological role in wetland ecosystems by providing habitat and food for various aquatic organisms.
